qas.question: In which park did Everton FC originally play?
Where was the new Liverpool FC stadium located in 1879?
Who donated land to Everton FC in 1882?
Who was the chairman of the Everton FC in 1892?
Where did Everton FC relocate their games to in 1892?
What was the name of the stadium at Priory Road?
What was the name of the stadium in Anfield?
In what year did John Houlding become Everton's chairman?
In what city is Goodison Park?
In what year was the stadium built at Priory Road?

context: Everton originally played in the southeast corner of <a0_0><a1_0>Stanley<a0_0/> Park<a1_0/>, which was the site for the new <b5_0><b6_0>Liverpool F.C. stadium<b6_0/><b5_0/>, with the first official match taking place in 1879. In <b9_0>1882<b9_0/>, a man named <a2_0>J. Cruitt<a2_0/> donated land at Priory Road which became the club's home before they moved to <b8_0>Anfield<b8_0/>, which was Everton's home until <b7_0>1892<b7_0/>. At this time, a dispute of how the club was to be owned and run emerged with Anfield's owner and Everton's chairman, <a3_0>John Houlding<a3_0/>. A dispute between Houlding and the club's committee over how the club should be run, led to Houlding attempting to gain full control of the club by registering the company, "Everton F.C. and Athletic Grounds Ltd". In response, Everton left <a4_0>Anfield<a4_0/> for a new ground, Goodison Park, where the club have played ever since. Houlding attempted to take over Everton's name, colours, fixtures and league position, but was denied by The Football Association. Instead, Houlding formed a new club, Liverpool F.C.
